conclusion: Determine the area S of the part of the cylindrical surface from which light exits.
The semi-cylindrical body has a radius R and a length L.
Light enters the rectangular surface vertically, traveling along the length L without refraction initially.
Light will refract according to Snell's law when reaching the curved surface.
Refractive index of the semi-cylindrical body is n = 2, and refractive index of air is n0 = 1.
For light to exit the curved surface, angle of refraction in air must be ≤ 90 degrees.
Critical angle θc for total internal reflection is calculated as θc = 30°.
Light will exit the curved surface if angle of incidence θi is ≤ 30 degrees.
Light exits the portion of the curved surface where angle of incidence is ≤ 30 degrees.
Curved surface of the semi-cylinder is a half-circle with radius R.
Total curved surface area is πRL.
Fraction of curved surface from which light exits is 1/6.
Area S of the part of the cylindrical surface from which light exits is πRL/6.
